citations.narrative:
Eight of the wolf/dog hybrids at the facility have not had a physical examination by the attending veterinarian within the
last 12 months. A complete physical exam from head to tail is beneficial as it may alert the veterinarian to health
concerns that require attention. In addition, a physical examination can help monitor any ongoing health issues.
To be corrected by: August 15, 2022

Eight of the wolf/dog hybrids do not have current vaccinations for rabies, parvovirus and distemper. Vaccinations for
contagious and/or deadly diseases of dogs assist in disease control measures and help ensure the health and welfare of
these animals. To be corrected by: August 15, 2022
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
End Section

narrative:
3.13(a)(2) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
Eight of the wolf/dog hybrids at the facility have not had a physical examination by the attending veterinarian within the 
last 12 months.  A complete physical exam from head to tail is beneficial as it may alert the veterinarian to health 
concerns that require attention.  In addition, a physical examination can help monitor any ongoing health issues. 
To be corrected by:  August 15, 2022 
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
Eight of the wolf/dog hybrids do not have current vaccinations for rabies, parvovirus and distemper.  Vaccinations for 
contagious and/or deadly diseases of dogs assist in disease control measures and help ensure the health and welfare of 
these animals.  To be corrected by:  August 15, 2022 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives. 
 
End Section

species.common: GRAY WOLF / GREY WOLF / TIMBER WOLF
